section.name: Welcome to gwt-maven
section.p: gwt-maven is a Google Web Toolkit plugin for Maven.

dl.dt:
context.xml:
This is a Tomcat specific file that sets container stuff such as JNDI data sources, realms, etc.
Hosted Mode: gwt-maven will use an app local context.xml *with* the GWT Hosted Mode development server by merging app local content (context.xml) with the required service servlet entries, creating the Tomcat root structure before running Hosted Mode. Basically this allows you to HAVE a context.xml that will matter im Hosted Mode.

web.xml:
This is a JEE specification file known as the "deployment descriptor".
Hosted Mode: gwt-maven will use an app local web.xml *with* the GWT Hosted Mode development server, similarly to what it does with context.xml. Any web.xml resources defined will be available in Hosted Mode.
Creating a WAR: In addition to Hosted Mode conveniences gwt-maven will merge the GWT module file Service Servlet entries into an application local web.xml file when creating a WAR. This means service servlet entries need only be defined in the module, yet will be deployed, along with any other web.xml elements, automatically.
Incude the totsp mavenrepo in the maven.repo.remote location in your Maven project.
Make sure the plugin is present and have a look around at the goals
